function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Dependence on cyclical funding sources, such as seasonal tourism, may lead to financial instability and funding gaps.","Impact":"Financial instability and uncertain funding for ongoing management and salaries, leading to reduced capacity to respond to contagious disease outbreaks.","Mitigation":"Diversify funding sources to include long-term, dependable funding and explore alternative revenue streams not tied to seasonal fluctuations.","Technologies":"Financial modeling and forecasting technologies to anticipate and plan for funding fluctuations.","People":"Organizations relying on cyclical funding, government agencies responsible for public health and disease control.","Owner":"Funding organizations, government agencies, and public health authorities."},{"Description":"Heavy reliance on private sector investments may lead to prioritization of profit over public health and safety measures.","Impact":"Neglect of essential public health and safety measures, contributing to increased risk of contagious disease transmission.","Mitigation":"Establish regulations and incentives to ensure that private sector investments prioritize public health and safety, in addition to financial returns.","Technologies":"Monitoring and compliance technologies for enforcing health and safety regulations in private enterprises.","People":"Local community members, public health authorities, and organizations involved in disease control and prevention.","Owner":"Regulatory authorities, public health agencies, and community representatives."},{"Description":"Lack of long-term funding commitments from governments may deter private sector investments in income-generating enterprises, leading to reduced financial sustainability for disease prevention and control efforts.","Impact":"Diminished ability to establish income-generating enterprises and sustainable funding sources for disease prevention and control initiatives.","Mitigation":"Advocate for government policies that provide incentives and support for private sector investments in income-generating enterprises related to public health and disease control.","Technologies":"Policy advocacy and economic impact assessment tools to demonstrate the benefits of private sector investments in disease prevention and control.","People":"Private sector stakeholders, government policymakers, public health officials.","Owner":"Advocacy groups, government agencies, and public health organizations."}]}
